src:
Sinhua osudila varvarski napad na njene prostorije u Hongkongu

03 Nov 2019, 08:15












Kineska državna novinska agencija Sinhua osudila je danas napad prodemokratskih demonstranata na njene prostorije u Hongkongu za vreme protesta koji ulaze u peti mesec, nazvavši ga varvarskim činom.U kratkom saopštenju izdatom kasno sinoć Sinhua je osudila "varvarsko delovanje rulje" koja je razrušila i zapalila ulaz u njihovu poslovnu zgradu za Aziju i Pacifik u hongkonškom kvartu Van Čai.Jučerašnji napad na prostorije Sinhue bio je prvi od kada su pre skoro pet meseci počeli antivladini protesti i nemiri u toj poluautnomnoj teritoriji.Novi protesti planirani su danas u sedam kvartova, a demonstranti traže političku reformu i istinsku autonomiju pošto je vladajuća Komunistička partija obećala da će pojačati kontrolu u toj oblasti, jednoj od najslobodnijih finansijskih centara u svetu.Novinarsko udruženje Hongkonga je takodje osudilo svaki čin sabotaže protiv medija i pozvalo na prekid nasilja protiv novinara i medijskih organizacija.Mnogi u toj bivšoj britanskoj koloniji strahuju da Kina preuzima slobode garantovane Hongkongu kada je vraćen pod kinesku kontrolu 1977. godine.Kineska komunistička partija u petak je obećala da će uspostaviti i ojačati pravni sistem i mehanizam za osiguranja njegovog poštovanja da bi se sprečile strane sile da seju "separatizam, subverziju i sabortažu" u Hongkongu.Hongkong koji ime odvojen pravni sistem od kopnene Kine pokušao je da sprovede zakone protiv subverzije ali nije uspeo zbog protivljenja javnosti.Vlada Hongkonga saopštila je danas da će predsednica vlade Keri Lam koja je trenutno u Šangaju, u utorak otputovati u Peking. Ona treba da razgovara sa kineskim vicepremijerom Han Džengom i da se pridruži sastanku o razvoju šire zalivske oblasti čiji cilj je da se povežu Hongkong, Makau i još devet gradova u južnoj Kini.Policija je saopštila da je više od 200 ljudi privedeno tokom jučerašnjih protesta u više kvartova ostrva Hongkong i oblasti Kovlun. Medju njima je i petoro mladih, četiri muškarca i jedna žena, kod kojih je pronadjeno 188 benzinskih bombi, biber sprej i oprema za demonstracije kao što su kacige i naočare.Policijski zvaničnik Jeung Jiu-Lu rekao je da  su oni privredeni u stambenoj zgradi u Val Čaju i da policija istražuje da li iza njih postoji organizacija ili organizator.

Xinhua condemns a barbaric attack on her Hong Kong premises

03 Nov 2019, 08:15












China's Sinhua state news agency condemned the attack by pro-democracy protesters on its premises in Hong Kong during a month-long protest, calling it a barbaric act. to their Asia-Pacific office building in Hong Kong's Van Chai neighborhood. Yesterday's attack on Sinhu's premises was the first since anti-government protests and unrest in that semi-autonomous territory began nearly five months ago. New protests are planned in seven quarters today, with protesters are seeking political reform and genuine autonomy as the ruling Communist Party vowed to step up control in the area, one of the world's most liberal financial centers. The Hong Kong News Association also condemned any act of sabotage against the media and called for an end to violence against journalists and media organizations. Many in that former British colonies fear that China will take over the freedoms guaranteed to Hong Kong when it was returned to Chinese control in 1977. The Chinese Communist Party on Friday promised to establish and strengthen its legal system and mechanism to ensure its respect to prevent foreign powers from sowing "separatism, subversion and sabotage "in Hong Kong.Hongkong, whose name is a separate legal system from mainland China, tried to enforce anti-subversion laws but failed due to public opposition.The Hong Kong government announced today that Prime Minister Kerry Lam, currently in Shanghai, will travel to China on Tuesday Beijing. She is due to speak with Chinese Deputy Prime Minister Han Jeng and join a meeting on the development of a wider Gulf region aimed at connecting Hong Kong, Macau and nine other cities in southern China.Police said more than 200 people were detained during yesterday's protests in several quarters of Hong Kong Island and Kovlun area. Among them are five youths, four men and one woman, who were found with 188 petrol bombs, pepper spray and demonstration equipment such as helmets and glasses.Police official Jeung Jiu-Lu said they were being farmed in an apartment building in Val Tea and the police are investigating whether there is an organization or organizer behind them.
